revised_title: Magnetic Shielding Near Anisotropic Molecules: Multipolar Expansions
tldr: This article presents a formalism for calculating magnetic shielding near anisotropic molecules using multipolar expansions. The authors develop a method to calculate magnetic shielding at points outside the molecule and show that higher multipolar terms become important as the field-point approaches the molecule. They also derive formulae for the observables using second-order quantum mechanical perturbation theory.
